page.title: 07INFLUENCES: ARMY, QUINTON
page.content: At the outbreak of war in 1939, the {Royal Engineers needed a large depot. Although marshy then, 350 acres of flat land between Long Marston and Quinton was free from aerial attack and already near good rail links. Since that time, the{Royal Pioneer {Corps}has been associated with creating and running the depot.Also, the Alien Pioneer Battalion may account for the large number of locals of central European origin, especially from Poland. As army personel have become part of the village, with large areas of quarters adjacent to the council estates, so many{civilians}have been taken on for jobs{alongside servicemen and women. Some members of the local civilian population were even decorated for their Falklands War duties in 1982.
